#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make Dogs Adapt to the New Environment Quickly
#Text=When you bring your dog home , do n't rush to train it .
#Text=Give it a few days to understand its current situation and know who you are .
#Text=You can also use this time to understand its natural nature and personality , and once it has adapted to your environment and its surroundings , you can start teaching them .
#Text=The one exception is to get the dog to get used to the new home it lives in as soon as possible .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Create a good living space for your dog .
#Text=Because the environment has changed , it has brought a lot of pressure on the dog .
#Text=Therefore , after bringing the dog home , the dog should be placed in the proper position at home as soon as possible .
#Text=If the place is not big , arrange a dog in a corner of the living room , and prepare food and water , as well as toys to stabilize the dog .
#Text=If necessary , you can install a fence in a certain range to make the dog more secure , and also adapt to the new environment .
#Text=Introduce family members carefully .
#Text=Not every dog is approachable ; it does n't mean it 's not good , but it may take time to get used to it .
#Text=Introducing dogs and family members one by one , allowing dogs to adapt to this strange environment more quickly .
#Text=Pay attention to the reaction of the dog when it comes into contact with other people .
#Text=If the dog suddenly growls or wants to rush to the family , it should be stopped in time .
#Text=After all , not every member of the family can accept such a warm hug .
#Text=If the family is gone at night and the dog is already asleep , it should not be forced to wake the dog .
#Text=This will only be counterproductive .
#Text=Use appropriate reward training .
#Text=Training dogs should start small , which will make the dog listen to you more .
#Text=Of course , when the dog has just arrived at your home , it will not be forced to learn on the first day .
#Text=To get your dog accustomed to your instructions , keep in mind that instructions should not be complicated , and it is best to do it in single words .
#Text=When the dog follows the instructions , it can be rewarded , such as snacks or praise .
#Text=The dog will soon remember that obeying the instructions is good for it and expects to continue to receive the approval of the owner .
#Text=Arrange the toilet area .
#Text=It is also a big problem for dogs to go to the toilet .
#Text=After all , the owner has to work for a long time , and may not have time to take the dog out for a walk .
#Text=If you ca n't take your dog out to the toilet every day , you should prepare a special dog toilet for the dog and train the dog to use it .
#Text=Once you have decided on the location of the dog 's toilet , do not make changes as much as possible to avoid confusion .
#Text=Observe the dog carefully. .
#Text=When a dog comes to your home , you may be very excited .
#Text=At this time , as a master , you should try to keep the dog calm .
#Text=Do n't let too many strangers visit the first week of taking the dog home , so as not to affect the dog 's mood .
#Text=Let the dog have enough time to adjust the mood , and let you observe the behavior of the dog , there is no need for improvement .
#Text=Do n't be impatient .
#Text=Dogs , like humans , must have a break-in period to adapt to the new environment .
#Text=What you can do is to treat with patience , let love tolerate dogs , and make appropriate guidance to let the dog adapt to your home as soon as possible .
#Text=Try to spend time with the dog .
#Text=Then the dog will soon be able to integrate into the new environment and live happily .
